column3: Belarusian: Сямятычы Siamiatyčy) is a town in eastern Poland
column5: 209 inhabitants (2004). It is situated in the Podlaskie Voivodeship (since 1999); previously it was in Białystok Voivodeship (1975–98). It is the capital of Siemiatycze County.

column4: and with the 1569 Union of Lublin
